feed.title: NewsTracker: egypt
feed.subtitle: This is a news tracking demo

entry.title: Egypt jails 69 Islamists for torching church
entry.summary: Egypt jailed 69 Islamists for life Wednesday for torching a church near Cairo in August 2013 during a crackdown on supporters of ousted president Mohamed Morsi, a judicial official said.

entry.title: Leaders of Cyprus, Egypt, Greece to boost cooperation on combatting terrorism 'scourge'
entry.summary: NICOSIA, Cyprus - The leaders of Cyprus, Egypt and Greece have agreed to step up cooperation on combatting terrorism amid fears over worsening security conditions in neighboring countries including Libya.

entry.title: Egypt Announces Plans to Build New Capital
entry.summary: The Egypt Economic Development Conference that opened Friday is the government's centerpiece for showing that the country is ready for business.

entry.title: Egypt conference to tell world Egypt is ready for investment
entry.summary:
A much-hyped investment conference opens in Egypt's Red Sea resort of Sharm el-Sheikh Friday, March 13, 2015.

FILE - In this March 5, 2015 file photo, a homeless Egyptian child sleeps under a bridge in Cairo, Egypt.

FILE - In this Feb. 3, 2015 file photo, stray dogs rest in front of the Pyramids of Giza on the outskirts of Cairo, Egypt.

FILE - In this March 4, 2015 file photo, an Egyptian broom vender drives his motorized tricycle in Cairo, Egypt.

entry.title: First hanging over pro-Morsi violence in Egypt
entry.summary: A court in Egypt's second city Alexandria sentenced Ramadan and another Morsi supporter to death in 2014 after convicting them of throwing youths off an apartment block, killing one of them.

entry.title: Egypt conducts second wave of strikes against Islamic State in Libya in retaliation for mass beheading of Christians
entry.summary:
Calling for an international coalition to confront the insurgency on its border, Egypt confirmed it had conducted raids in the IS-stronghold of Derna, in Libya's east, backed by Libya's air force.

At least 64 militants were killed in Egypt's attacks, Libyan Air Force commander Saqer al-Joroushi told Egyptian state television, indicating further air strikes were planned for Tuesday.

Grief ... A man is comforted as he mourns the Egyptian Coptic Christians who were captured in Libya and beheaded by Islamic State jihadists, outside of the Virgin Mary church in the village of el-Aour, Egypt.

An Egyptian air force fighter jet lands at an undisclosed location in Egypt following air strikes in Libya.

entry.title: Sainsbury?s chief executive sentenced to jail in Egypt
entry.summary: "Mr El Nasharty is now claiming that Mike was in Egypt on 15th July 2014 and seized these cheques, which is an impossibility. Mike Coupe was in London carrying out his normal duties that day," the spokeswoman said.

entry.title: Sainsbury?s chief executive Mike Coupe sentenced to jail in Egypt
Sainsbury's boss in egypt legal row
As war rages at home, thousands from Yemen stranded in Egypt
entry.summary:
This Tuesday, April 21, 2015 photo shows, travel documents and medical statements of Yemeni housewife, Jatarh Obad at an apartment in Cairo, Egypt.

In this Tuesday, April 21, 2015 photo, Yemeni man Jamil, right, and his daughter Reemas, rest at their rented apartment in Cairo, Egypt.

This Sunday, April 19, 2015 photo shows, papers filled with names of Yemenis pasted on a wall outside the Yemeni embassy, in Cairo, Egypt.

In this Tuesday, April 21, 2015 photo, Saleh Hadad, a Yemeni man from the s Marib province, right, rests on a couch with his mother in-law, in the living room of their rented apartment in Cairo, Egypt.

entry.title: As War Rages at Home, Thousands From Yemen Stranded in Egypt
As Saudi-led airstrikes, rebel offensive rages, thousands from Yemen remain stranded in Egypt
entry.summary: And while some in Yemen make a perilous voyage across the sea to Djibouti to begin lives as refugees, many of those in Egypt simply want to return home.

entry.title: As war rages at home, thousands from Yemen stranded in Egypt
entry.summary:
CAIRO (AP) - As a Shiite rebel offensive and Saudi-led airstrikes rage on in Yemen, thousands of Yemenis remain stuck in Egypt, unable to return home.

Abu Bakr Badheeb, the spokesman of the Yemeni Embassy in Cairo, said 4,700 of the 5,800 citizens of his country now in Egypt want to return.

entry.title: Sudan's pyramids, nearly as grand as Egypt's, go unvisited
entry.summary: The steep, small pyramids rise over the desert hills, a stunning reminder of the ancient Nubian kingdom that once ruled Egypt _ and ones not nearly as often visited those of its neighbor.

entry.title: Sudan's pyramids, nearly as grand as Egypt's, go unvisited
entry.summary:
AL-BERGAWIYA, Sudan (AP) - The small, steep pyramids rising up from the desert hills of northern Sudan resemble those in neighboring Egypt, but unlike the famed pyramids of Giza, the Sudanese site is largely deserted.

The pyramids at Meroe, some 200 kilometers (125 miles) north of Sudan's capital, Khartoum, are rarely visited despite being a UNESCO World Heritage site like those in Egypt.

The pyramids bear decorative elements inspired by Pharaonic Egypt, Greece and Rome, according to UNESCO, making them priceless relics.

entry.title: Sudan's pyramids, nearly as grand as Egypt's, go unvisited
entry.summary: The pyramids at Meroe are deserted despite being a UNESCO World Heritage site like those at Giza in Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt Basks in World Support at Investor Conference
entry.summary: A jubilant Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi acknowledged Egypt's road to recovery will be long and costly, but described the three-day summit as an overwhelming success, recognizing companies and governments for their vote of confidence.

entry.title: Egypt's top businessman Naguib Sawiris testifies at al-Jazeera trial
Turkey criticizes Egypt's sentencing of ousted leader Morsi
entry.summary: A Foreign Ministry statement said Wednesday that "arbitrary" trials in Egypt deepened doubts over the objectiveness of Morsi's trial and "reinforced concerns" over the future of democracy in the country.

entry.title: Turkey criticizes Egypt's sentencing of ousted leader Morsi
entry.summary: Turkey's government strongly supports Morsi's Muslim Brotherhood group and relations between Egypt and Turkey soured after Morsi's ouster led by Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi.

entry.title: Turkey criticizes Egypt's sentencing of ousted leader Morsi
14 killed in IS bombings in Egypt's Sinai
entry.summary: Egypt is also facing a threat on its western border from a chaotic Libya where the influence of IS -- which has seized chunks of Syria and Iraq -- is growing.

entry.title: In Egypt, ex-military men fire up Islamist insurgency
entry.summary:
They pose a danger to U.S. ally Egypt with their knowledge of the Arab world's biggest army, provide militants with training and strategic direction, and even carry out suicide bomb attacks against government officials.

Men like Ashmawy, who is on the run, are especially troubling for Egypt which is struggling to contain a complex web of militants who roam from the Sinai to Libya, another hub for extremists.

entry.title: Egypt imposes life jail penalty for cross-border tunnel use
entry.summary: Egypt declared a state of emergency in the border area last year after at least 33 security personnel were killed in attacks in the Sinai Peninsula, a remote but strategic region bordering Israel, Gaza and the Suez Canal.

entry.title: Egypt-Saudi differences over Syria, Libya raise questions over joint Arab action
entry.summary:
Egypt's rhetoric has emphasized the need to preserve Syria as a bulwark against terrorists over the need to remove Assad, though the government has avoided saying that outright.

Notably, Assad - who did not attend the summit - told Russian reporters ahead of the gathering that Egypt understands the crisis in Syria and that there is limited security cooperation between the two countries.

Russia is a key supporter of Assad and has strong ties to el-Sissi, who gave Putin a lavish welcome in Egypt last month.

entry.title: Egypt carries out hanging over violence after Morsi's ousting
entry.summary: Egypt has carried out the first death sentence handed down over the violence that erupted after the army overthrew former president Mohamed Morsi in 2013, the interior ministry said.

entry.title: Egypt court suspends legislative election after court ruling
Egypt bombs Islamic State targets in Libya after 21 Egyptians beheaded
entry.summary: Fears the crisis in Libya could spill across the border had already prompted Egypt, the Arab world's most populous nation, to upgrade its military hardware.

entry.title: Egypt to try another 379 Brotherhood members over sit-in violence
Militants attack church and police in Egypt, one policeman dead
Egypt to try 48 for killing journalist, two civilians
entry.summary:
Ashraf is among 10 Egyptian journalists killed in Egypt since the 2011 uprising that ousted former president Hosni Mubarak, according to New York-based Committee to Protect Journalist (CPJ).

Egypt on Saturday referred to trial 48 suspects accused of shooting dead a journalist, a boy and a Christian woman during clashes last year between Islamist protesters and police.

entry.title: Egypt acquits Mubarak-era minister in last graft case
Investors commit $10.7 billion in deals including power, tourism at Egypt economic conference
entry.summary: At the end, the participants join el-Sissi in a chant of his oft-used slogan "long live Egypt!"

entry.title: Analysis: Egypt embarks on ambitious anti-terror campaign
entry.summary: Egypt already has military advisers on the Saudi-Yemeni border tasked mainly with developing a joint strategy with the Saudis to confront future hostilities, according to the officials, who have first-hand knowledge of Egypt's plans.

entry.title: Egypt's former president Mohammed Morsi sentenced to 20 years
entry.summary: A life sentence in Egypt is 25 years.

entry.title: Court sentences ousted Egypt president to 20 years in prison
entry.summary:
The case was the latest in a series of mass trials on a range of charges against Morsi and other members of his Muslim Brotherhood, which Egypt's government has vowed to crush, branding it a terrorist organization.

Egypt's Sinai Peninsula is the scene of a months-old insurgency by militants who have pledged allegiance to the Islamic State group, and there have been frequent low-level but often deadly bombings targeting police and the military in Cairo.

entry.title: Court Sentences Ousted Egypt President to 20 Years in Prison
entry.summary: Egypt's ousted Islamist president, Mohammed Morsi, was convicted of using force against protesters and sentenced to 20 years in prison on Tuesday, the first verdict against him since he was removed by the military nearly two years ago.

entry.title: Court sentences ousted Egypt president to 20 years in prison
entry.summary: The Brotherhood was the biggest winner in subsequent parliament elections, and Morsi - running as its candidate - became Egypt's first freely elected president in 2012.

entry.title: Egypt's ousted president Morsi jailed for 20 years
Famed Egypt poet El Abnoudy, chronicler of rural life, dies
AP PHOTOS: Powder-covered workers toil in Egypt's quarries
US releases military aid to Egypt, cites national security
entry.summary:
And it comes at a time when Arab nations have expressed concern about Washington's negotiations with Iran over its nuclear program, questioning whether the U.S. is aligning itself with Tehran instead of its long-standing allies in the region, like Egypt.

White House spokeswoman Bernadette Meehan said the assistance will help address the growth of a group in Egypt, affiliated with Islamic State militants, that has attacked Egyptian soldiers and civilians.

entry.title: Egypt to try policeman over death of female protester
entry.summary: Egypt's state prosecutor referred on Tuesday a police officer to trial for allegedly shooting dead a leftist female protester during a peaceful rally in central Cairo.

entry.title: Archaeologists in Egypt discover 3000-year-old tomb in Luxor, beautifully painted
entry.summary: CAIRO - Egypt's Ministry of Antiquities says American archeologists have discovered a 3000-year-old tomb with beautifully painted walls belonging to a nobleman who guarded the temple of the ancient deity Amun.

entry.title: Egypt's ousted president Morsi jailed for 20 years
entry.summary: "This verdict shatters any remaining illusion of independence and impartiality in Egypt's criminal justice system," said Hassiba Hadj Sahraoui, Amnesty's deputy Middle East and North Africa director.

entry.title: Gunmen kill 15 soldiers, two civilians in Egypt's Sinai
entry.summary: Egypt is gradually recovering from years of political turmoil following the ouster of autocrat Hosni Mubarak in 2011 and foreign investors are starting to return.

entry.title: Saudi Arabia, Egypt show discord over Syria
entry.summary:
Egyptian President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi chairs an Arab foreign ministers meeting during an Arab summit in Sharm el-Sheikh, South Sinai, Egypt, Sunday, March 29, 2015.

The agreement is a telling sign of a new determination among Saudi Arabia, Egypt and their allies to intervene aggressively in regional hotspots, whether against Islamic militants or spreading Iranian power.

entry.title: Court sentences ousted Egypt president to 20 years in prison
entry.summary: The ruling, which can be appealed, reflects the dramatic downfall of Morsi and the drastic challenges facing Egypt since its 2011 uprising that forced longtime autocrat Hosni Mubarak from power.

entry.title: Canadian journalist awaiting trial in Egypt signs book deal
entry.summary: Al-Jazeera English journalist Mohamed Fahmy, who remains in Egypt on bail while awaiting trial on terror charges, has signed a book deal.

entry.title: Nigeria, Egypt paired in Africa Cup of Nations draw
entry.summary:
Egypt have won the biennial Cup of Nations tournament a record seven times, Cameroon four times, Nigeria three times and South Africa once.

Nigeria and Egypt were drawn together and so were Cameroon and South Africa in the highlights of the 2017 Africa Cup of Nations qualifying draw made Wednesday in Cairo.

entry.title: Egypt to try 16 over football stadium deaths
entry.summary: Egypt's state prosecutor Tuesday referred to trial 16 suspects accused of clashing with police that led to a deadly Cairo football stadium stampede, blaming the Islamist opposition for the violence.

entry.title: Kerry promotes US investment in Egypt; no new military aid
entry.summary: SHARM EL-SHEIKH, Egypt (AP) - Secretary of State John Kerry delivered words of encouragement Friday for Egypt's efforts to attract greater foreign investment but no new military assistance as demanded by the country's president.

entry.title: Egypt names Cuper from Argentina to lead its soccer team
entry.summary: Egypt's team has been without a fulltime manager since American Bob Bradley quit in late 2013 after he failed to take the Pharaohs to the World Cup in Brazil.

entry.title: Ousted Egypt president Mohamed Mursi sentenced to 20 years
entry.summary: Egypt's first freely elected leader, Mursi came to power following the 2011 ouster of longtime autocrat Hosni Mubarak in a popular uprising.

entry.title: Mohammed Morsi gets 20 years in prison over killing of Egyptian protesters
entry.summary:
The ruling, which can be appealed, and muted Islamist reaction following it underscore the dramatic downfall of Morsi and Egypt's once-powerful Muslim Brotherhood group.

The heavy sentences have raised questions about the independence of Egypt's judiciary, something analysts say could have contributed to the sentence Morsi received Tuesday.

entry.title: Court Sentences Ousted Egypt President to 20 Years in Prison
entry.summary: The Cairo Criminal Court issued the verdict Tuesday as Morsi and other defendants in the case stood in a soundproof glass cage inside a makeshift courtroom at Egypt's national police academy.

entry.title: Egypt's president meets CIA director in Cairo for talks
entry.summary: Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi, right, meets with CIA director John Brennan, center, and the director of Egypt?s General Intelligence Directorate Khaled Fawzy in Cairo.

entry.title: Egypt's president meets CIA director in Cairo for talks
entry.summary: Egypt increasingly has been targeted by Islamic militants and its strategic Sinai Peninsula is home to an extremist group that has pledged its loyalty to the Islamic State group.

entry.title: Egypt's president meets CIA director in Cairo for talks
entry.summary:
CAIRO (AP) - Egypt's president has held talks with CIA director John Brennan in Cairo that touched on regional conflicts and terrorism.

Egypt remains a key U.S. regional partner, despite tensions following el-Sissi's overthrow of Islamist President Mohammed Morsi in 2013.

entry.title: Egypt court seeks death sentence for 11 in soccer stadium case
entry.summary: Soccer matches are often a flashpoint for violence in the country but the Port Said incident was Egypt's worst ever soccer disaster, killing more than 70 fans and injuring at least 1,000.

entry.summary: The judge referred the sentencing to Egypt's Grand Mufti, the country's most senior religious authority, a step towards the death penalty, which could be imposed at a later court hearing on May 30.

entry.title: Egypt court sentences 11 to death over 2012 football riot
entry.summary: Sunday's death sentences against 11 football fans have been referred to Egypt's grand mufti.

entry.title: UK archbishop Welby in 'condolence' visit to Egypt
entry.summary: The Archbishop of Canterbury Justin Welby, leader of the Church of England, arrived in Egypt on Sunday to offer his condolences over the beheadings of 21 Egyptian Coptic Christians by jihadists in Libya.

entry.title: Egypt runners defy Cairo mayhem as sport's popularity grows
entry.summary: FILE - In this Friday, April 10, 2015 file photo, runners take advantage of Cairo's empty streets during an organized run in the Mohandisseen district of Egypt's capital.

entry.title: Egypt runners defy Cairo mayhem as sport's popularity grows
entry.summary:
But when the runners describe how the sport has brought them together, and how they have reclaimed their city's squares and streets, one hears an echo of the early days of Egypt's 2011 uprising, when a spirit of inclusiveness prevailed in Cairo's Tahrir Square.

In this Friday, April 10, 2015 picture, Egyptian runs cross a street in the Mohandiseen district in Cairo, Egypt.

In this Friday, April 17, 2015 photo, Egyptian volunteers hold balloons to support passing runners participating in Cairo's annual Half Marathon in the Heliopolis district in Cairo, Egypt.

entry.summary: Egypt said it and Saudi Arabia had discussed holding a "major military manoeuvre" in Saudi Arabia with other Gulf states, following talks on the progress of the three-week-old Saudi-led campaign of air strikes against the Houthis in Yemen.

entry.summary: Sunday is Eastern Orthodox Easter in Egypt, and police have been on high alert against attacks.

entry.title: Egypt Muslim Brotherhood verdicts "blatantly unjust" - Human Rights Watch
entry.summary:
"The fact that those who publicized the mass killings of 2013 could go to prison for life while those who did the killings receive official accolades perfectly symbolizes the abject failure of transitional justice in Egypt," she said.

HRW also criticised a recent U.S. decision to end a freeze on military aid to Cairo at the same time as the Egypt judiciary had been passing sentences against journalists and the political opposition.

entry.title: Two bomb attacks in Egypt's Sinai kill 13, wound dozens

entry.title: Suicide attack kills two on Egypt's Sinai Peninsula
entry.summary: Cairo: A suicide car bomb targeting a police station in Egypt's restive Sinai Peninsula has killed two people and wounded 30 others, police and medics say.

entry.title: Egypt police says it has arrested critical journalist
entry.summary: An evolving crackdown on dissent in Egypt has landed thousands of government critics behind bars and silenced many critical voices.

entry.title: Egypt police says it has arrested critical journalist
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) - Egypt has arrested a journalist on claims he is wanted in seven different cases - just days after he published a series of critical articles about the police.

entry.summary:
The attacks took place as Egypt's defense minister carried out a limited military reshuffle, replacing the commander of the army division responsible for securing northern Sinai.

Gen. Mohammed el-Shahat, who only commanded Egypt's second field army for about a year, was promoted to head of military intelligence; el-Shahat's deputy, Maj.

entry.title: Egypt court confirms death sentence for Brotherhood head, 13 others
entry.summary: So far Egypt has executed one Islamist sentenced to death after Morsi's overthrow, following his conviction of involvement in the murder of a youth during violent protests in July 2013.

entry.title: Egypt sentences Muslim Brotherhood leader, others to death
entry.summary: Rights groups say Egypt, where a popular uprising toppled veteran autocrat Hosni Mubarak in 2011 and started years of political turmoil, is now cracking down on all dissent.

entry.title: Egypt court sentences US-Egyptian citizen to life in prison
entry.summary:
Mohamed Elmessiry, the Egypt researcher for rights group Amnesty International, said in a phone interview that Saturday's verdicts were "politically motivated."

Egypt's official news agency said the court upheld death sentences for 14 people, including the leader of the country's banned Muslim Brotherhood, and sentenced 37 others to life in prison.

entry.title: Egypt Court Sentences US-Egyptian Citizen to Life in Prison
entry.summary:
Last year he sentenced three journalists from Al-Jazeera English to jail terms ranging from seven to 10 years, a verdict that exposed Egypt to global complaints of suppressing media freedom.

Since Morsi's ouster, Egypt has faced international criticism for conducting mass trials with judges issuing severe sentences.

entry.title: Muslim Brotherhood leader, 13 others receive death sentence in Egypt
entry.summary: The group says it is committed to peaceful activism and had nothing to do with Islamist militant violence in Egypt since Morsi's fall following mass protests against his rule.

entry.title: Report: Court sentences US-Egypt citizen to life in prison
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) - Egypt's state-run news agency is reporting that a criminal court has sentenced a dual U.S.-Egyptian citizen on a monthslong hunger strike to life in prison.

entry.title: Egypt court confirms death sentence for Brotherhood chief, 11 others
Egypt sentences Muslim Brotherhood leader, others to death
entry.summary: The sentences can be appealed before Egypt's highest civilian court in a process that could take years to reach a final verdict.

entry.title: Egypt to try another 379 Brotherhood members over sit-in violence
entry.summary:
Prosecutions against members of the security forces are rare in Egypt where the police have reasserted powers eroded since the 2011 popular uprising that ousted autocrat Hosni Mubarak.

Foreign governments and rights groups have condemned the use of force to disperse demonstrations at Nahda and Rabaa squares, the bloodiest event in Egypt's recent history.

Egypt's government faces an Islamist insurgency based in that strategic region and growing discontent with what critics perceive as heavy handed security tactics.

entry.title: Nigeria, Egypt paired in Cup of Nations draw
In Egypt, ex-military men fire up Islamist insurgency
Moody's raises Egypt's credit rating, says economy improved
entry.summary:
CAIRO (AP) - Moody's Investor Service has upgraded Egypt's credit rating, saying macroeconomic performance has improved and external vulnerabilities have been reduced.

In a statement, it ranked Egypt at B3 on its scale - speculative and subject to high credit risk - with a stable outlook, an improvement from its previous classification of Caa1.

entry.title: Egypt photojournalist describes detention of over 600 days
entry.summary: The Committee to Protect Journalists said in December that at least 12 journalists, including three Al-Jazeera journalists are detained in Egypt.

entry.title: AP PHOTOS: Powder-covered workers toil in Egypt's quarries
entry.summary: MINYA, Egypt (AP) - In the desert of southern Egypt, workers in limestone pits look as though they stepped out of a blizzard, covered in the white powder of the stones that are the economic lifeblood of this region.

entry.title: AP PHOTOS: Powder-covered workers toil in Egypt's quarries

entry.title: Explosion hits bridge in central Cairo, killing at least 1

Human Rights Watch urges Egypt to halt executions of 6 men convicted by military court
entry.summary: CAIRO - A rights group is urging Egypt to halt the execution of six men condemned to death by a military tribunal for killing security forces, citing lawyers and family who contend some of them were in jail at the time of the attack.

entry.title: Egypt's Islamic State branch claims responsibility for Sinai attack that killed 15 troops
entry.summary: CAIRO - The Islamic State's branch in Egypt has claimed responsibility for a wave of deadly attacks that killed 15 Egyptian soldiers and three civilians the previous day in volatile northern Sinai.

entry.title: Militant attacks in Egypt's volatile Sinai kills 15 Egyptian troops, 3 civilians

entry.summary: The two attacks, which also wounded 11 soldiers and several civilians, come as Egypt battles a growing insurgency in the northern Sinai, which borders Israel and the Gaza Strip.

entry.title: Gunmen kill five soldiers in Egypt's Sinai: security sources
entry.summary: ISMAILIA, Egypt (Reuters) - Gunmen attacked several checkpoints in Egypt's Sinai Peninsula on Thursday, killing at least five soldiers, security sources said.

entry.title: Report: Egypt, Nigeria led world in death sentences in 2014
entry.summary: Egypt and Nigeria accounted for well over 1,000 of the death sentences announced in 2014, Amnesty International says in its latest annual report of executions and countries' use of the death penalty, released on Wednesday, April 1, 2015.

Report: Egypt, Nigeria Led World in Death Sentences in 2014
entry.summary: Other countries resuming executions in 2014 were Jordan, Singapore, Egypt, Belarus, the United Arab Emirates and Equatorial Guinea, the report said.

entry.title: Report: Egypt, Nigeria led world in death sentences in 2014
entry.summary: Egypt announced at least 509 death sentences last year, many of them in the mass trials that have been held since the ouster of Islamist President Mohammed Morsi in 2013.

entry.title: Obama ends freeze on U.S. military aid to Egypt
entry.summary:
WASHINGTON (Reuters) - The United States announced on Tuesday it was lifting its hold on the supply of military equipment to Egypt, which was frozen when the military took power in Cairo nearly two years ago.

The White House said President Barack Obama was freeing up the equipment and making other changes to military ties with Washington's long-time ally to support U.S. interests while encouraging Egypt's political reforms.

Egypt, which has worked with the United States on Middle East peace moves, is emerging from a period of domestic upheaval and is engaged in several regional conflicts, including in neighboring Libya, and fighting Islamic State militants at home.

entry.title: Egypt, Nigeria led world in death sentences last year, rights group report says
entry.summary: UNITED NATIONS - Amnesty International says Egypt and Nigeria accounted for well over 1,000 of the death sentences announced last year, more than a third of the world's total.

entry.title: Obama lifts hold on U.S. military aid to Egypt
entry.summary: Obama has been reviewing military aid to Egypt since 2013 when the Egyptian army ousted former president Mohamed Mursi.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt
entry.summary: President Barack Obama on Tuesday released military aid to Egypt that was suspended after the 2013 overthrow of the government, in an effort to boost Cairo's ability to combat the extremist threat in the region.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt, cites national security
entry.summary:
The White House said Egypt will remain the second-largest recipient of U.S. foreign military financing worldwide.

The aid comes as Egypt is trying to play a leading role in forming an Arab military alliance that can fight terrorism in the region.

entry.title: Obama lifts freeze, ships arms to Egypt
entry.summary: "In this way, we will ensure that U.S. funding is being used to promote shared objectives in the region, including a secure and stable Egypt and the defeat of terrorist organizations," said National Security Council spokeswoman Bernadette Meehan.

entry.title: Obama lifts hold on U.S. military aid to Egypt
entry.summary: The United States also will target its aid toward equipment used for counterterrorim, border security, maritime security and Sinai security, and for sustaining weapons systems already used by Egypt, the White House said.

entry.title: Obama says U.S. will provide more military aid to Egypt
entry.summary: Obama also said that the United States would discontinue starting in fiscal 2018 Egypt's use of cash flow financing, a financial mechanism that allows Egypt to buy equipment on credit, the White House said.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt, cites national security
entry.summary: The White House said Obama also reiterated U.S. concerns about Egypt's continued imprisonment of activists and encouraged increased respect for freedom of speech and assembly.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt, cites national security
entry.summary: Egypt has been arguing it needs the money to face growing threats from extremists creeping over the border from lawless Libya or operating in the Sinai Peninsula, and the U.S. sees the funds as critical for stability in the volatile Middle East.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt, cites national security
entry.summary: The funds were suspended 21 months ago when el-Sissi, then military chief, overthrew Egypt's first democratically elected leader, Islamist President Mohammed Morsi.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt, cites national security
entry.summary:
WASHINGTON (AP) - President Barack Obama is releasing military aid to Egypt that was suspended after the 2013 coup in that country.

The White House says Obama is lifting the hold on sending F-16 fighter jets, tanks and other material to Egypt.

entry.title: US releases military aid to Egypt, cites national security
Egypt court frees 68 activists in rare move
Saudi Arabia, Egypt show discord over Syria
entry.summary:
CAIRO (AP) - Egypt and Saudi Arabia are cooperating militarily to thwart a power grab in Yemen by Shiite rebels, but the agreement on how to deal with the region's complex and intertwined conflicts may stop there.

In Libya, el-Sissi wants regional action against the growing power of Islamic militants, whom Egypt and the United Arab Emirates have already hit with airstrikes several times the past year.

entry.title: 14 killed in car crash in Egypt's southern Sohag province
entry.summary: The collisions killed about 13,000 people in Egypt in 2013.

entry.title: 14 killed in car crash in Egypt's southern Sohag province
entry.summary: SOHAG, Egypt (AP) - A senior Egyptian security official says 14 people have been killed and seven injured in a car crash involving three vehicles in the southern province of Sohag.

entry.title: Saudis, Egypt consider intervention in Yemen, likely by air
entry.summary: Egypt would have to send its planes to air bases in Saudi for the raids, and other countries would likely opt to do the same.

entry.title: Saudis, Egypt consider intervention in Yemen, likely by air
entry.summary:
Egypt has said for months that it would act if the Houthis threaten vital shipping lanes that lead to its Suez Canal through the Gulf of Aden, an area the Houthis have already approached.

More likely now would be airstrikes by some combination of Saudi Arabia, UAE or Bahrain, all of which have advanced versions of American F-16s, or Egypt, which has large numbers of older versions.

entry.title: Saudis, Egypt consider intervention in Yemen, likely by air
entry.summary: A summit of Arab leaders being held this weekend in Egypt is due to address a proposal to create a joint Arab defense force, an idea promoted by Saudi Arabia and Egypt to intervene in regional crises.

entry.title: Yemen allies Saudi Arabia and Egypt consider intervention in Yemen, but likely only by air
entry.summary: CAIRO - With Yemen's president swept out of power by Shiite rebels, neighboring Saudi Arabia and allies such as Egypt are considering whether and how to intervene to stop a takeover of the country by rebels they believe are backed by Shiite Iran.

entry.title: Egyptian leader defends Nile rights in Ethiopia's parliament
entry.summary:
El-Sissi said Wednesday in a speech before Ethiopian lawmakers that Egypt will continue depending on the Nile without being threatened by other downstream countries.

The leaders of Sudan, Egypt and Ethiopia on Monday signed an initial agreement outlining principles by which they will cooperate to use the water fairly.

entry.title: Egypt fires forensics official over comments on killed woman
entry.summary: The killing of el-Sabbagh, a mother of a young boy, at a Jan. 24 demonstration on the eve of the anniversary of Egypt's 2011 uprising, provoked intense public outcry.

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia hope for long-term Nile River cooperation
entry.summary:
ADDIS ABABA, Ethiopia (AP) - The leaders of Ethiopia and Egypt say they hope ongoing talks over sharing the waters of the Nile River will lead to a final agreement.

Egyptian President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi told reporters in the Ethiopian capital of Addis Ababa, where he is on an official visit, that Ethiopia and Egypt are "on the right path to cooperation."

entry.title: Egypt fires forensics official over comments on killed woman
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) - Egypt's forensics authority has dismissed its spokesman, a doctor who said last weekend that a female protester killed by police in January died because she did not have enough fat on her body to protect against shotgun pellets.

entry.title: Egypt fires forensics official over comments on killed woman
Roadside bomb kills two soldiers in Egypt's Sinai
Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan sign Nile dam accord
entry.summary: Egypt, which relies almost exclusively on the Nile for farming, industry and drinking water, has sought assurances that the dam will not significantly cut the river's flow to its rapidly growing population.

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan sign accord over Nile waters
entry.summary: Experts have estimated that Egypt could lose as much as 20 percent of its Nile water in the three to five years needed for Ethiopia to fill the dam's massive reservoir.

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan sign accord over Nile waters
entry.summary:
The dam had been an issue of contention among the three countries, with Egypt concerned it would reduce its share of the Nile established under a colonial-era agreement that gave Egypt and Sudan the main rights to exploit the river's water.

But in 2013, Ethiopia's parliament unanimously ratified a new accord that replaced previous deals that awarded Egypt veto powers over Nile projects.

They said at the time that work on the dam, some 20 kilometers (12 miles) from Sudan's eastern border, will continue during consultations with Cairo, and that experts had already agreed that the dam would not significantly affect water flow to both Egypt and Sudan.

In his speech in Khartoum, el-Sissi said that Egypt was a dry country that used its 55.5 billion cubic meter-share of the water, whereas other countries through which it flowed received much more rainfall.

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan sign accord over Nile waters
entry.summary: Egypt previously had voiced fears that Ethiopia's $4.2 billion hydro-electric project would diminish its share of the Nile, which provides almost all of the desert nation's water needs.

entry.title: Egypt, Ethiopia and Sudan Sign Accord Over Nile Waters
Official: German killed by shark on Egypt's Red Sea Coast
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) - An Egyptian security official says a shark killed a German citizen on Egypt's Red Sea Coast.

entry.title: Egypt, Emirati developers tout nebulous plan for new capital
entry.summary: "Egypt is facing a housing shortage and serious population growth pressures, so the move to meet that demand in new urban areas outside of Cairo is a good idea," Cairo-based urban planner Josh Drake said.

entry.title: Egypt, Emirati developers tout nebulous plan for new capital
entry.summary:
Is a flashy Dubai-style city feasible in impoverished Egypt?

"Real estate is now considered the engine of Egypt's growth and what better way to stimulate it, in spite of the dismal record of new desert towns to date, than to proclaim a colossal new capital?"

entry.title: Egypt, Emirati developers tout nebulous plan for new capital
Egypt court adjourns Al-Jazeera retrial to Wednesday
Egypt to require tourists to obtain visas in advance
entry.summary: Previously, tourists from many countries including Europe and the United States could purchase visas upon entry to Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt to require tourists to obtain visas in advance
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) - Foreign Ministry spokesman Badr Abdellaty says authorities will require individual foreign tourists who are not travelling in groups to Egypt to obtain a visa in advance from embassies in their own countries for the time being.

entry.title: Egypt to try police officer for killing female protester
entry.summary:
The two cases had renewed accusations from rights groups and political activists that Egypt's powerful police force enjoys almost blanket impunity.

Amnesty International said authorities in Egypt are covering up excessive use of force by police, taking no action to rein in abuse.

Almost all of the over 100 policemen tried for killing protesters during Egypt's 2011 revolution were acquitted, with judges citing shoddy investigation or lax evidence in cases largely probed by the police themselves.

The uproar over el-Sabbagh's death prompted Egypt's President Abdel-Fattah el-Sissi to urge an investigation but he hinted that individual mistakes should not undermine public confidence in the police.

entry.title: Egypt to try police officer for killing female protester
entry.summary:
Egypt's chief prosecutor has referred a police officer to trial for the deadly shooting of a female protester killed earlier this year during a peaceful demonstration.

The statement said the defendants confessed to receiving money to plot the chaos outside the stadium in order to destabilize the country and cause a recent international donor conference hosted by Egypt to fail.

entry.title: Egypt sacks 41 judges for supporting Muslim Brotherhood: judicial sources
Businesses upbeat on Egypt's chances at investment meeting
entry.summary:
Egypt, the Arab world's most populous country, faces a power shortage causing rolling blackouts that affect tens of millions of people, one of several woes the government is addressing.

Jeff Immelt, CEO of General Electric Co., said that despite the risks, Egypt is a key piece of its global strategy, which considers opportunities over the long term.

entry.title: Businesses upbeat on Egypt's chances at investment meeting
entry.summary:
They include a new 4.4-gigawatt power plant in southern Egypt, a project to generate 2 gigawatts of wind power and a new wind rotor blade factory.

Egypt's Oil Ministry said in a statement that the Eni deal was worth an estimated $5 billion ($4.8 billion euros) and would develop oil and gas resources.

entry.title: Bomb explodes near bank in Egypt's Alexandria, wounding 4
Kerry: Decision soon on unfreezing US military aid to Egypt
entry.summary:
SHARM EL-SHEIKH, Egypt (AP) " U.S. Secretary of State John Kerry says the U.S. will make a decision "very soon" on how to unfreeze hundreds of millions of dollars in suspended American military assistance to Egypt.

Egypt has been trying to get F-16s fighter jets, tanks and other materiel to combat the extremist threat spilling over from Libya and in the Sinai Peninsula.

entry.title: Egypt Rakes Billions in Gulf Aid That Boosts Its President
entry.summary: The gathering of royals, heads of state, top international officials and businessmen was also an opportunity for el-Sissi to put behind him criticism over the military's 2013 ouster of Egypt's elected president, Islamist Mohammed Morsi.

entry.title: Egypt rakes billions in Gulf aid that boosts its president
entry.summary: "To stand by Egypt is to breathe life into the future of the (Arab) nation," the UAE's prime minister and ruler of Dubai, Sheikh Mohammed bin Rashid Al Maktoum, told the assembly.

entry.title: Egypt rakes billions in Gulf aid that boosts its president
entry.summary: Egypt's Gulf Arab allies promised it $12 billion in new investment and aid on Friday, as El-Sissi opened the conference to promote an ambitious recovery plan for his country's ailing economy.

entry.title: Egypt rakes billions in Gulf aid that boosts its president
entry.summary: Kuwait's Emir Sheikh Sabah Al Ahmad Al Sabah announced that his oil-rich nation would invest $4 billion in Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt announces plans to build new capital
entry.summary:
A model of a planned new capital for Egypt is on display at a major economic conference in Sharm el-Sheikh, Egypt, Friday, March 13, 2015.

SHARM EL-SHEIKH, Egypt (AP) - Egypt's government announced Friday plans to build a new capital adjacent to Cairo, in a massive new project that in its first phase would cost $45 billion and take up to seven years to complete.

entry.title: Egypt conference to tell world Egypt is ready for investment
entry.summary: FILE - In this Feb. 11, 2015 file photo, young students walk to their homes during a sandstorm in 6 October city, a suburb southwest of Cairo, Egypt.

entry.title: Egypt executes man for throwing 2 to their deaths from roof
Egypt investigates explicit video filmed at the pyramids
entry.summary:
Egypt investigates explicit video filmed at pyramids Add to...

Egypt is investigating how foreign tourists managed to film a pornographic video near the Giza pyramids, the government said.

entry.title: Egypt executes man for throwing 2 to their deaths from roof
entry.summary: On Friday, the U.S. Embassy in Cairo released a security message for U.S. citizens in Egypt, advising them to "review their personal security plans and remain alert to their surroundings at all times."

entry.title: Egypt executes man for throwing 2 to their deaths from roof
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) - Egypt executed a man by hanging on Saturday, the first capital punishment carried out in connection with violence that followed the ouster of the country's Islamist president in 2013.

entry.title: Egypt executes 'supporter' of Muslim Brotherhood
entry.summary: Saturday's execution came a month after Egypt's high court upheld the death sentence against Ramadan.

entry.title: Silence in Egypt over police abuses amid "war on terror"
entry.summary: The Feb. 1 incidents, which took place in two neighboring districts, went largely unnoticed in Egypt.

entry.title: BP signs $12B deal to develop Egypt gas field
entry.summary: BP Group Chief Executive Bob Dudley says the project is his company's "largest foreign direct investment in Egypt."

entry.title: Emirates forges special relationship with el-Sissi's Egypt
entry.summary:
FILE - In this Wednesday, Feb. 11, 2015, file photo, Emirati officials visit the UAE Egypt stand during the last day of the Government Summit in Dubai, United Arab Emirates.

In this Wednesday, March 5, 2015 photo, Egyptians walk in front of Sheikh Zayed Al Nahyan hospital in Cairo, Egypt.

In contrast, before Morsi's fall, Egypt had been in talks for several years with the International Monetary Fund for a $4.8 billion loan, but the talks never reached a deal.

Egyptian officials have said Egypt, Saudi Arabia, Kuwait and UAE were in talks late last year over creating a military pact to face militants.

entry.title: Emirates forges special relationship with el-Sissi's Egypt
entry.summary: In addition to providing direct cash aid, the OPEC member has been building schools, clinics, wheat silos and tens of thousands of homes as part of at least $10 billion earmarked for Egypt since Morsi's ouster.

entry.title: An exhausted Egypt finds aid, focus on investment from business-savvy United Arab Emirates
entry.summary: A UAE government report shows that Egypt is by far the biggest single recipient of donor cash from the Emirates, with $4.6 billion distributed just in 2013, the most recent year for which data is available.

entry.title: Emirates forges special relationship with el-Sissi's Egypt
entry.summary:
The United Arab Emirates has pumped billions of dollars into Egypt and is lining up investors to try to stabilize its damaged economy, while building military cooperation.

Egypt's prime minister, Ibrahim Mahlab, had a prime speaking spot, which he used to praise the Emirates' "wise leadership" and the two nations' friendship.

The Emirates is also a key organizer of an economic development conference aimed at enticing investors to Egypt and reviving its economy, to be held next week in the Sinai resort of Sharm el-Sheikh.

entry.title: Emirates forges special relationship with el-Sissi's Egypt
entry.summary:
Minister of State Sultan al-Jaber, an Emirati official with one of the few seats on the conference's steering committee, promised the event will be "a first step in the implementation of a larger strategy that will ensure Egypt's economic revival."

The Emirates, Saudi Arabia and Kuwait pumped billions of dollars into Egypt following the military's ouster of Islamist President Mohammed Morsi in July 2013.

entry.title: Egypt court suspends parliamentary elections
entry.summary: Egypt has not had an elected legislature since 2012, when the Supreme constitutional Court ruled that parliament's lower chamber was not constitutionally elected.

entry.title: 11 wounded, one critically, in bomb blast near Egypt court: medics
entry.summary: Those bombs and several others that killed policemen in Cairo were claimed by the Ajnad Misr (Soldiers of Egypt) jihadist group.

entry.title: Egypt parliamentary poll set for delay after court ruling
entry.summary:
Cairo: Egypt's parliamentary poll looks set to be delayed after a court ruled part of an election law was unconstitutional and the main election committee said it was working on a new timetable for the long-awaited vote.

The latest development highlights Egypt's rocky path towards democracy since the ousting of Islamist president Mohamed Morsi in 2013 by the army after mass protests against the rule of Egypt's first democratically elected leader.

Egypt has been without a parliament since June 2012 when a court dissolved the democratically elected main chamber, reversing a major accomplishment of the 2011 uprising that toppled autocrat Hosni Mubarak.

entry.title: Egypt sentences Mohamed Badie and members of Muslim Brotherhood to death
Egypt court lists Hamas 'terrorist group,' sentences Brotherhood members
entry.summary:
After the January decision against Hamas' Qassem Brigades, a source close to the armed wing signaled the group would no longer accept Egypt as a broker between it and Israel.

Badie has already been sentenced to multiple life terms, and was one of hundreds given the death sentence in a mass trial that drew international criticism of Egypt's judicial system.

entry.title: Egypt's resorts safe, German beauties say
entry.summary:
Soma Bay is part of a string of resorts billed as Egypt's "Red Sea Riviera," known for world-class diving and sandy beaches that are open year-round.

The Tourism Ministry says 9.9 million tourists came to Egypt in 2014, a slight increase from the previous year, driven by a 47 percent surge from Eastern Europe - notably 3.1 million Russians.

Americans and Western Europeans are still largely avoiding Egypt, in part because of government travel warnings.

entry.title: Al-Jazeera journalist optimistic Egypt retrial will clear him of wrongdoing
entry.summary: The journalists and their network said they were caught in a political dispute between Egypt and Qatar, which sponsors Al-Jazeera and had been a strong backer of Morsi during his divisive year in power.

entry.title: Al-Jazeera producer hopes to be cleared in Egypt retrial
entry.summary:
Mohammed said he spent 411 days in three different prisons in Egypt, including a maximum security facility where he had to sleep on a damp cement floor in a cell six and a half feet wide.

The Committee to Protect Journalists listed Egypt in 2014 as one of the 10 worst jailers of journalists around the world, along with China, Iran, Turkey and Ethiopia.

entry.title: Correction: Egypt story
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) - A judicial official in Egypt has denied that the country's toppled Islamist president and a deputy leader of the Muslim Brotherhood have been referred to a military tribunal.

entry.title: Egypt's el-Sissi wants a U.N.-backed coalition on Libya
entry.summary:
Egypt is making an ambitious bid to place itself at the center of the fight against extremism across the Middle East.

CAIRO - Egypt's president said in a radio interview aired on Tuesday that creating a U.N.-backed coalition was the best course of action to rid Libya of Islamic extremists.

entry.title: Egypt's el-Sissi wants a UN-backed coalition on Libya
Egyptian warplanes strike IS targets in Libya, pushes for joint international intervention
entry.summary:
Egypt now faces threats on two fronts - a growing stronghold of radicals on its western border and a militant insurgency of Islamic State allies on its eastern flank in the Sinai Peninsula - as well as its own internal challenges.

The announcement on state radio represents Egypt's first public acknowledgement of military action in post-Moammar Gadhafi Libya, where there has been almost no government control.

Without publicly acknowledging it, Egypt and the United Arab Emirates carried out airstrikes against Islamist-allied militias last year, according to U.S. officials.

entry.title: Egypt strikes IS in Libya, pushes for international action
entry.summary: The airstrikes bring Egypt overtly into Libya's turmoil, a reflection of Cairo's increasing alarm.

entry.title: Civilians killed as Egypt launches air strikes in Libya
entry.summary: Egypt later confirmed it had signed a $5.8bn deal to buy French weaponry, including 24 Rafale combat jets, a multi-mission naval frigate and air-to-air missiles.

entry.title: Egypt bombs IS targets in Libya
Egypt strikes back at Islamic State militants after beheading video, killing dozens
entry.summary: Security officials say militants based in Libya have established ties with Sinai Province, a group operating from Egypt's Sinai Peninsula that has pledged allegiance to Islamic State.

entry.title: Egypt strikes back at Islamic State militants after beheading video, killing dozens
entry.summary:
It was the first time Egypt confirmed launching air strikes against the group in Libya, suggesting President Abdel Fattah al-Sisi is ready to escalate his battle against militants seeking to topple his government.

In a phone call to Al Arabiya television, Brigadier Saqer al-Joroushi, the commander of the air force loyal to Libya's official government, said more air strikes would be carried out in co-ordination with Egypt.

Egypt, the most populous Arab state, has not taken part directly in the US-led air strikes against Islamic State targets in Iraq and Syria, focusing instead on the increasingly complex insurgency within its own borders.

entry.title: Egypt strikes back at Islamic State militants after beheading video, killing dozens
entry.summary: CAIRO: Egypt said it bombed Islamic State targets inside Libya, a day after the group released a video appearing to show the beheading of 21 Egyptians there.

entry.title: Egypt strikes Islamic State group in Libya after video of mass killing
entry.summary: "Egypt and the whole world are in a fierce battle with extremist groups carrying extremist ideology and sharing the same goals."

entry.title: Egypt Strikes ISIS Targets In Libya After Grisly Video Is Released
entry.summary:
Egypt said Monday it has launched airstrikes against Islamic State targets in Libya after the extremist group released a grisly video showing the beheading of several Egyptian Coptic Christians it had held hostage for weeks.

Egypt has strongly backed the internationally recognized government, and U.S. officials have said both Egypt and the United Arab Emirates have taken part in a series of mysterious airstrikes targeting Islamist-allied forces.

entry.title: Egypt strikes IS group in Libya after video of mass killing
entry.summary:
France, a lead player in the campaign to oust Gadhafi, has campaigned for months for some kind of international action in Libya, and announced a deal Monday to sell fighter jets to Egypt.

Michael reported from el-Aour, Egypt.

entry.title: Ousted Egypt president starts latest trial on spying charge
entry.summary: Morsi, overthrown in July 2013 following mass protests demanding his resignation, does not recognize the court, and insists Egypt's current leadership came to power in a coup d'etat and is thus illegitimate.

entry.title: Ousted Egypt president starts latest trial on spying charge
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) - A new trial for Egypt's ousted ex-president opened Sunday in Cairo, with prosecutors accusing him of espionage and leaking confidential information to Qatar while in office.

entry.title: Gunmen kill policeman in Egypt's Nile Delta
entry.summary: CAIRO (AP) " Egypt's state news agency says gunmen opened fire on a traffic police patrol in the Nile Delta town of Benha, killing one policeman and wounding three others.

entry.title: 2 Al-Jazeera journalists freed from prison in Egypt
entry.summary: Baher was initially sentenced to 10 years in prison and Fahmy to seven years but Egypt's top appeals court subsequently ordered a retrial after overturning the initial ruling, citing "flawed evidence."

entry.title: Egypt releases 2nd of 3 Al-Jazeera journalists
entry.summary: Since the ouster, Egypt has been cracking down heavily on Morsi's supporters, and the journalists were accused of being mouthpieces for the Brotherhood and falsifying footage to suggest that Egypt faces civil war.

entry.title: 2 Al-Jazeera journalists freed from prison in Egypt
Al Jazeera's Mohamed Fahmy released on bail in Egypt
